title: Non-Volatile Memory (NVM) Design Engineer, Staff
description: At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

metadata.job_description_and_requirements: We Are:At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.You Are:You are a passionate and experienced circuit designer, eager to push the boundaries of Non-Volatile Memory (NVM) technology. With a robust background in analog circuit design and hands-on experience leading NVM projects through all stages of development, you thrive in dynamic, cross-functional environments. Your expertise covers both the theoretical and practical aspects of memory architecture, device physics, and advanced process nodes, including deep insight into layout considerations and the subtleties of parasitic effects, matching techniques, and signal integrity.As a team player, you communicate effectively across cultures and disciplines, collaborating seamlessly with engineers, layout designers, and application specialists. You are highly self-motivated, detail-oriented, and take pride in delivering innovative, high-quality IP solutions. Your analytical mindset and problem-solving skills enable you to tackle complex electrical issues, perform root cause analysis, and develop robust solutions that drive successful silicon outcomes. You are comfortable with modern EDA tools, have a knack for debugging at the silicon level, and are well-versed in statistical design methodologies. Whether supporting sales teams during customer engagements or mentoring junior engineers, you bring leadership, initiative, and a drive for continuous improvement to every project. Above all, you are passionate about shaping the future of memory technology and making a tangible impact in a global leader like Synopsys.What You’ll Be Doing:Leading the NVM TestChip and IP design flow across multiple technologies and foundries, ensuring robust and scalable solutions for diverse applications.Architecting, designing, and verifying CMOS-based non-volatile memory IP modules, from concept to production tapeout.Collaborating with product engineers to perform silicon verification, in-depth testing, and debugging to validate IP performance on silicon.Conducting post-layout extraction, simulation, and comprehensive testing in conjunction with silicon validation teams.Working closely with on-site and off-site design, layout, and CAD teams to optimize design methodologies and ensure project success.Partnering with layout designers on floor planning of memory arrays and analog blocks for performance, area, and manufacturability optimization.Serving as the technical expert to support Sales and Application Engineers during complex pre- and post-sales customer engagements, ensuring customer satisfaction and successful product adoption.The Impact You Will Have:Driving the development of next-generation NVM IP that powers cutting-edge semiconductor products worldwide.Enhancing the reliability, performance, and scalability of Synopsys’ memory solutions, directly influencing customer product success.Accelerating time-to-market for advanced SoCs by delivering robust, silicon-proven NVM IP.Contributing to the adoption of best-in-class design methodologies, elevating design quality and productivity across the organization.Empowering cross-functional teams with your technical leadership, mentoring, and collaborative spirit.Shaping the roadmap of memory technology in advanced process nodes, positioning Synopsys as a leader in the industry.Ensuring seamless customer experiences by providing expert technical support and resolving complex design challenges.What You’ll Need:5–12+ years of industry experience in circuit design, with a strong emphasis on analog circuit design and analysis; memory design experience is a significant plus.Deep understanding of layout considerations for advanced nodes, including parasitic effects, matching techniques, and signal integrity.Expertise in electrical problem-solving, including root cause analysis of circuit failures and development of effective solutions.Hands-on experience with TestChip tapeout flows, silicon debugging (FIB, micro-probing, post-layout RC extraction), and statistical design methodologies (e.g., Monte-Carlo analysis).Strong transistor-level analog design skills, including sense-amplifier, charge pump, high voltage regulator, and bandgap reference circuit design.Proficiency with circuit simulation tools (HSIM, HSPICE, etc.) and custom schematic/layout editors (e.g., Custom Compiler).Experience with low power design, power management circuitry, and FinFET design is a plus.Who You Are:A collaborative team player who thrives in multicultural, cross-functional teams.Independent, self-motivated, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Detail-oriented with a strong commitment to quality and innovation.Excellent communicator, both written and verbal, able to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.Proactive problem-solver with a passion for continuous learning and technical excellence.

title: Sr. Quality Engineer (CQE required)
description: Our Senior Quality Engineer will lead the development and implementation of quality improvement initiatives aligned with organizational goals, particularly focusing on New Product Development Introduction (NPDI), New Product Development Initiatives (NADI), projects, pilot studies, and verification/validation activities. The role ensures quality is deeply integrated into product and process designs, driving a culture of quality awareness and continuous improvement across R&D, product management, and manufacturing functions. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Integrating Design for Quality principles by incorporating quality requirements into product and process designs to minimize defects. Conducting quality reviews and gate checks at different NPDI stages to verify quality readiness. Providing guidance on creating documented Control Plans outlining process controls to maintain quality. Identifying and analyzing quality gaps and developing actionable quality improvement plans. Facilitating cross-functional collaboration among R&D, product management, manufacturing, and other teams to ensure quality objectives are met. Monitoring quality metrics and performance indicators to guide continuous quality improvement. Participating in root cause investigations and implementing preventative measures. Utilizing quality tools (e.g., FMEA, CAPA, RCA, 8D, PDCA, Value Stream Mapping, GEMBA walks) to help teams systematically identify issues, analyze causes, and implement improvements. Facilitating design reviews and validations to catch potential issues early in product and process development.

title: Crew
description:
Is it you?

Our Crew Members create a warm and friendly shopping experience in our stores.  We answer questions, offer suggestions, and ensure our customers know they are welcomed and cared for.  We entertain customers and make grocery shopping an exciting adventure. 

Some responsibilities may include:

  • Working on teams to accomplish goals
  • Operating the cash register in a fun and efficient manner
  • Bagging groceries with care
  • Stocking shelves
  • Creating signage to inform and delight customers
  • Helping customers find their favorite products

You'll learn a lot. You're not stuck doing one task here. Each Crew Member contributes to creating a WOW customer experience by participating in all aspects of the job.

If you have experience in art including penmanship, working with chalk, and large signage, that's a plus. 

If you have a passion for people and a fervor for food, we'd love to meet you.  We can teach you the rest.

Stores have the greatest need for people that can work evenings and weekends.

Trader Joe's is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse Crew.

title: Home Support Worker -Brisbane Southside
description:
The opportunity

Our Home Support Workers don’t just provide care, they build lasting relationships.

By working consistently with the same clients, you will become a trusted companion who delivers truly personalised support. Every service and activity is thoughtfully tailored to each client’s health, happiness, independence, interests and choices, empowering them to live life on their own terms, with dignity and joy.

We currently have opportunities for Home Support Workers in Brisbane’s southern suburbs and Logan .  

Enjoy flexible working hours to suit your availability and work-life balance.

How you will make an impact as a Home Support Worker

You’ll enjoy flexible hours, a small supportive team, and the chance to make a meaningful difference every day.

•    Help with errands around the home, including cleaning, washing, ironing and vacuuming. 

•    Support with personal hygiene and showering, grooming and dressing.

•    Assisting with shopping and meal preparation.

•    Monitoring medication.

•    Scheduling and attending appointments. 

•    Providing companionship and engaging in social activities.

What your compassion looks like

As a compassionate and dependable individual who takes pride in delivering excellent customer service – ideally with experience in the health or aged care sector – you will bring:

•    A warm and caring nature 

•    The ability to work autonomously and as part of a team 

•    A positive and practical attitude 

•    Strong communication skills 

•    A current driver’s license and access to a reliable, registered and insured vehicle

•    Certificate III in Individual Support (Aged Care) or equivalent 

•    Current First Aid & CPR Certificate 

•    WWVP  Card WITH NDIS Endorsement

•    Medication Administration Competency

If you are currently studying your nursing degree and have completed an aged care clinical placement, or you have an overseas nursing qualification, we want to hear from you. Your compassion and dedication are exactly what we are looking for.

Benefits that support and reward you

•    Flexibility - experience the flexibility to balance work and life

•    Competitive rates - earn competitive hourly rates with opportunities for overtime

•    Development - grow your career through comprehensive training and development programs

•    Study Assistance - whether you're starting out or advancing your qualifications, our Study Assistance Program supports everything from traineeships to Bachelor Degrees

•    Reward and recognition - your dedication won’t go unnoticed. Our reward and recognition initiatives celebrate the great work you do every day.

•    Discounts on selected health insurance and access to wellbeing services.

Belonging at Regis Home Care 

We are proud to support over 10,000 residents and clients across residential aged care homes, home care, retirement living, day therapy and day respite centres. The work we do positively impacts the lives of older people and their families. It really is work you can feel good about.

We offer flexible hours, competitive rates and a supportive environment where your work is truly valued.

At Regis, real impact starts with you.


 Regis Aged Care Pty Ltd trading as BodeWell Community Care.

title: Principal Engineer - ASIC Digital Design IP Development (Ethernet/UALink Protocols)
description: At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

metadata.job_description_and_requirements: Alternate Job Titles:Principal Engineer - ASIC Digital Design IP Development (Ethernet/UALink Protocols)We Are:At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.You Are:You are a highly experienced and passionate ASIC Digital Design expert with a strong track record in architecting, implementing, and delivering cutting-edge RTL designs for high-performance IP cores. Your expertise spans across protocols such as Ultra Accelerator (UALink), Ethernet, DDR, PCIe, and USB, and you thrive on solving complex technical challenges in fast-paced, multi-site environments. You bring over 12 years of hands-on experience in ASIC design, including control path-oriented architectures, synthesis flows, and verification methodologies.As a technical leader, you are adept at mentoring junior engineers, leading small teams, and ensuring design excellence through robust documentation and quality processes. You have a keen eye for detail, proven proficiency in synthesizable Verilog/System Verilog coding, and a deep understanding of design flows, including CDC analysis, static timing, and formal checking. Your collaborative spirit shines when working with global teams, and you communicate technical concepts with clarity and confidence, whether with colleagues or customers.You are driven by innovation and continuous learning, always seeking to stay ahead in technology trends relevant to IP core development for Enterprise, Commercial, and Automotive applications. Your initiative, problem-solving skills, and ownership of deliverables make you a valued contributor in any project. You’re looking for an environment where your technical expertise, leadership, and passion for excellence will have a significant impact on next-generation silicon solutions.What You’ll Be Doing:Architecting and designing state-of-the-art RTL for DesignWare IP cores, focusing on protocols such as UALink, Ethernet, DDR, PCIe, and USB.Creating and documenting detailed architecture and micro-architecture specifications for medium to high complexity design components.Performing individual contributor and technical lead responsibilities, including RTL coding, synthesis, CDC analysis, debugging, and test development.Collaborating with verification teams on test planning, coverage planning, and verification closure to ensure high-quality deliverables.Interacting with customers to understand and translate specification requirements into robust design solutions.Mentoring and technically leading a team of designers, driving best practices and continuous improvement across global teams.The Impact You Will Have:Deliver next-generation IP cores for high-performance applications in Enterprise, Commercial, and Automotive sectors.Advance Synopsys’ leadership in ultra-fast accelerator link and Ethernet technology through innovative design and architecture.Ensure robust, scalable, and high-quality ASIC designs that meet and exceed customer requirements.Facilitate cross-functional collaboration, driving design efficiency and verification excellence in multi-site teams.Contribute to the successful adoption of Synopsys IP by leading customers worldwide, enabling breakthrough silicon solutions.Enhance team expertise through mentorship, technical guidance, and fostering a culture of innovation and continuous learning.What You’ll Need:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering (BSEE/MSEE) with 12+ years of relevant ASIC design experience.Expertise in protocols such as UALink, Ethernet, DDR, PCIe, USB, and hands-on experience with control path-oriented designs (e.g., asynchronous FIFO, DMA, RAM interfaces).Proficiency in synthesizable Verilog/System Verilog RTL coding, simulation, and design verification tools.Strong background in lint, CDC, synthesis, static timing analysis, formal checking, and P&R-aware synthesis flows (Fusion Compiler experience is a plus).Experience with revision control systems (Perforce or similar), scripting languages (Perl/Shell), and exposure to IP design quality processes.Who You Are:Innovative problem-solver with a proactive approach and strong initiative.Excellent communicator, able to bridge technical details with team members and customers.Collaborative team player, thriving in diverse, global environments.Mentor and leader, passionate about developing talent and sharing knowledge.Detail-oriented professional committed to delivering high-quality, reliable solutions.The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:You’ll join the DesignWare IP Design R&D team at Synopsys’ Bangalore Design Center, collaborating with expert engineers across multiple global sites. The team is dedicated to developing high-performance IP cores for a broad range of applications, emphasizing technical excellence, innovation, and quality. You will work in an environment that encourages learning, growth, and leadership, contributing to products that shape the future of silicon design.Rewards and Benefits:We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

title: Registered Nurse - SA
description:
Registered Nursing Opportunities – South Australia | Aged Care

Annual Salary from AU$76,471 to $100,638 + superannuation + penalties

Level of experience and skill will determine grade and salary

•    South Australia, Australia - Metro & Regional Locations

•    Locations include Burnside, Kingswood, Marleston, Playford.

•    Link for more information: https://www.regis.com.au/aged-care-facilities/locations/

•    Full time and Part time available 

•    Develop your Nursing career with a leading Aged Care provider

•    Work for a values driven organisation 


The opportunity  

Join our passionate team who love what they do and can support you in building your career at Regis Aged Care.  Our continuity of carer model means you will have the time to build strong relationships through being the familiar face our residents rely upon. 

At over 84 locations supported by 12,000 employees across Australia, there are endless opportunities to grow or progress your career in any way you want.  


What your compassionate care looks like 

•    You will keep a nurturing eye on each resident’s condition, and provide proactive care that enriches their daily life 

•    Manage care plans that support residents’ holistic needs. You will provide respectful, tailored support that empowers their choices and independence 

•    Ensure safe medication and accurately document medication plans, interventions and progress notes  

What you will bring to the role 

•    A true passion for caring for others to deliver personalised holistic care that supports residents and ensures needs are met  

•    Strong communication skills 

•    Bachelor's Degree in Nursing (or equivalent) 

•    Current AHPRA registration (Nursing) 

•    The ability to quickly build your knowledge of the AN-ACC funding system attributes (experience with this system would be even better) 

•    Experience providing nursing services, whether in aged care, hospitals or community care settings 

•    An appreciation for the importance of accurate reporting and documentation management  

•    The ability to lead, effectively supervise and delegate tasks to our PCA/AINs


Benefits that support and reward you  

•    Flexibility - experience the flexibility to balance work and life

•    Competitive Rates - earn competitive hourly rates with opportunities for overtime

•    Development - grow your career through comprehensive training and development programs

•    Study Assistance - whether you're starting out or advancing your qualifications, our Study Assistance Program supports everything from traineeships to Bachelor Degrees 

•    Reward and Recognition - your dedication won’t go unnoticed—our reward and recognition initiatives celebrate the great work you do every day 


Belonging at Regis 

We are proud to support over 10,000 residents and clients across residential aged care homes, home care, retirement living, day therapy and day respite centres. The work we do positively impacts the lives of older people and their families. It really is work you can feel good about. 


What our nurses love about working here 

At Regis, you will have the resources to do your best clinical work, the opportunity to grow your career faster than expected, and the encouragement to make more of a difference. This difference will be felt every day in our residents’ lives, by helping us build the aged care older Australians deserve. 


You will be valued as a clinical leader, and supported by managers and peers who genuinely love what they do. Care goes both ways, and your wellbeing is a priority. With clear processes and excellent working conditions, you'll feel more confident and in control, making your job more rewarding. 


At Regis, real impact starts with you. 

No matter your role, you can take pride in knowing you are making a real, lasting impact on people’s lives and helping to shape the future of aged care in Australia. It is work you can feel good about. #JoinRegis 


To work in residential aged care, you will need to provide satisfactory background checks, including NDIS or police check (role dependent), current year flu vaccination, and certification proof.

title: Burger King Restaurant Assistant Manager
description:
We are looking for Restaurant Assistant Managers (RAM)to join our team. Our restaurants are staffed with amazing people, and we are looking for more. The RAM supports the Restaurant General Manager in their efforts to develop a team of dedicated people, delivering great and friendly guest experiences and producing top line sales. They do this by learning, managing and teaching restaurant systems effectively to achieve goals, develop people and provide excellent service.  RAM's bonus on performance, both operationally and financially.

Job Duties:

	* Ensure your team provides outstanding service and satisfied guests
	* Train and coach the team
	* Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a great restaurant every shift, every day
	* Implement restaurant controls, especially cash & inventory
	* Set and meet restaurant goals for service, operations and financial results
	* Meet all operational standards, including speed of service, food safety and cleanliness
	* Meet positive food and labor variance and take appropriate action to improve results
	* Maintain a clean and safe working environment
	* Work all shifts as required by the business
	* Set an example by maintaining an excellent working knowledge and high level of proficiency in restaurant operations
	* Provide feedback and coaching to the team
	* Demonstrate problem solving skills
	* Follow all government regulations, employment laws, food safety and operations policies and implement all accounting controls
	* Any / all other duties as assigned by the Restaurant General Manager (RGM)

Physical Requirements:

	* Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching
	* Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures
	* Ability to stand for 8-10 hours
	* Ability to lift up to 20lbs

Job Requirements:

	* 1-3 year of supervisory experience in a restaurant or retail setting
	* Excellent customer service skills
	* Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
	* Must have reliable vehicle and valid driver's license
	* Must be at least 18 years of age & authorized to work in the US
	* ServSafe certification preferred

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with…

	* Strong, performance-based bonus program
	* Regular performance reviews
	* Health & Life Benefits
	* HSA program
	* Generous Paid Time Off benefits
	* Employee Rewards & Recognition Program
	* Career development through structured training programs

title: Senior Marketing Executive
description: Does working for a global company as part of an international marketing team excite you? We're looking for a Senior Marketing Executive to be actively involved in developing, planning and driving marketing projects to successful completion for METTLER TOLEDO's Product Inspection Division - specifically for our X-ray business unit, based in Royston.If you're a creative professional who enjoys transforming ideas into effective marketing campaigns, and excel at managing multiple projects while staying focused on achieving results, we want to hear from you!What You'll DoLead the end-to-end delivery of marketing campaigns, including brochures, e-Guides, datasheets, telesales guides and multimedia content.Collaborate in agile development cycles and coordinate with teams for content review, landing page creation, and campaign execution.Engage and align with internal stakeholders and Strategic Business Units (SBUs) through regular meetings and feedback sessions.Audit and review existing marketing materials to ensure consistency, accuracy, and avoid duplication.Coordinate translation and localisation processes for global markets.Prepare monthly and quarterly summary presentations for leadership and stakeholder briefings.Create and manage social media assets and scheduled posts for LinkedIn and other platforms to support organic and paid promotions while maintaining consistent visibility for X-ray products.Coordinate video interview production, editing, approvals, and integration into marketing materials and web pages.

metadata.position_description_&_requirements: POSITION SUMMARYRadiology Partners is expanding our premier practice to support our exciting growth throughout the state of Florida.  RP Florida is currently seeking a Board Certified/Board Eligible Interventional Radiologist to join our talented team primarily servicing HCA Florida Tampa Hospitals. The ideal candidate will be able to perform a broad range of IR procedures and have a passion to grow and advance our IR program.Opportunity Highlights:Competitive compensation model with production incentives and opportunity for annual increasesMultiple bonus options available2-year partnership track8 weeks of vacationDaytime shift Monday – Friday; Q4 IR CallIR case mix supplemented with diagnostic readsAdditional moonlighting opportunities available during surge timesFully integrated workstation under RP Cloud Enterprise tech stack; Includes Intelerad PACS, Clario Worklist, and PowerScribe dictation software to maximize efficiency and streamline workflowsContinued AI enhancements through platforms and programs such as Aidoc, RecoMD, and Best Practice Recommendation (BPR) TemplatesComprehensive benefits package offered including malpractice coverageLOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEWRP Florida serves 8 HCA hospitals and multiple freestanding emergency rooms across the Greater Tampa region and Florida’s Gulf Coast. We provide expertise across all major radiology subspecialties, offering both on-site and remote reading services, along with a variety of procedural cases. Our team-based model fosters exceptional patient care through the strategic use of shared resources, state-of-the-art technology, and comprehensive support at both the national and local levels. By joining this team, you'll become a member of a well-supported, physician-led, and highly collegial group!Florida offers a unique blend of lifestyle, convenience, and entertainment for all its residents. Withno state income tax, you can keep more of your earnings and enjoy everything the state has to offer. The sunny, warm climate makes it ideal for year-round outdoor activities like boating, beach outings, fishing, and water sports. There are several different housing options and communities to invest in from coastal beach towns to major metropolitan areas. The state also features world-renowned attractions like Disney World and Universal Studios, and its diverse culture, influenced by Latin America and the Caribbean, brings vibrancy to everyday life. If you’re seeking sunshine, a relaxed lifestyle, and rich culture, Florida could be the perfect place for you to call home.DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEFellows and residents welcome to applyCandidates must be residency-trained in Diagnostic RadiologyFellowship training in IR or Integrated IR residency requiredBoard eligible or certified by      American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of      Radiology (AOBR)FL License required or the ability to obtain a FL LicenseCOMPENSATION:The salary range for this position is $425,000-$500,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).For More information or to apply:For inquiries about this position, please contact Nicole Maclin atrecruiting@radpartners.comor 843-300-1623.RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEWRadiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe, and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion, and a healthy respect for differences.Radiology Partners participates inE-verify.Beware of Fraudulent Messages:Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team atrecruiting@radpartners.com.

title: [2026 - MEX] Record to Report Coordinator (Sin OP)
Popeyes Restaurant General Manager
description:
We are looking for Restaurant General Managers (RGM) to join our team. Our restaurants are staffed with amazing people, and we are looking for more. The RGM leads the operation of the restaurants and has the overall responsibility for making sure the restaurant meets GPS Hospitality standards of quality, service and cleanliness. The RGM does not do this alone, as they work with a team of managers. RGM's bonus on performance, both operationally and financially.

Here are the top five (5) responsibilities of the job:
• (P&L) Hit Your Sales and Profit Budget Every Period
• (Systems) Execute Accurate Projections and Schedules While Working All Shifts
• (Safety) Maintain a Safe and Clean Restaurant
• (People) Hire and Train Service Obsessed Crew and Shift Leaders
• (Accounting) Tight Restaurant Controls 

Additional Job Duties:
• Ensure team provides outstanding service and satisfied guests.
• Hire, train and coach the restaurant team.
• Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a high-quality restaurant, especially accurate projections and great schedules.
• Implement restaurant controls, especially cash & inventory.
• Frequent contact, both inside and outside the restaurant, with the public, business, and various community organizations to develop and improve the restaurant’s public relations.
• Meet standards for speed of service, food safety and cleanliness.
• Demonstrate strong critical thinking skills.
• Maintain a clean and safe working environment and ensure all equipment is clean and maintained.
• Work all shifts (breakfast, lunch, dinner late night & weekends) each week. Work at least one (1) full weekend each period.
• Set an example by maintaining an excellent working knowledge and high level of proficiency in restaurant operations.
• Follow all government regulations, employment law, food safety, operations policies and cash policies and implement all accounting controls.
• Supervise in accordance with GPS values, traits and behaviors.
• Communicate effectively with all levels of management about plans, progress and problems.
• Successfully implement all marketing promotions.
• Participate in the implementation of company policies, standards, training and management development.
• Train and develop the capabilities of Assistant Managers and Manager Trainees in the areas of management skills and technical knowledge to provide for growth.

Physical Requirements: 
Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching 
Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures 
Ability to stand for 8-10 hours 
Ability to lift up to 20lbs

Job Requirements:
• 3-5 years of General Manager experience in a restaurant or retail setting
• High School Diploma or GED preferred
• Excellent customer service skills
• Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
• Must have reliable vehicle and valid driver's license
• Must be at least 18 years of age & authorized to work in the US
• ServSafe certification preferred

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with…
• Strong, performance-based bonus program
• Regular performance reviews
• Health & Life Benefits
• HSA program
• Generous Paid Time Off benefits
• Employee Rewards & Recognition Program
• Career development through structured training programs

title: Day Breast Radiologist - Northside Radiology Associates

metadata.position_description_&_requirements: LOCAL PRACTICE OVERVIEWNorthside Radiology Associates has been the provider of radiological services at Northside Hospital since 1970. Northside Hospital is a large and continuously expanding hospital system in metro Atlanta covering 25 counties with five acute-care hospitals, more than 300 outpatient facilities, and over 3,700 providers.Our team of 70+ board-certified radiologists is highly subspecialized, ensuring top-tier patient care within the Northside system. We pride ourselves on quality, providing excellent patient care and upholding a healthy work-life balance. Maximizing the ability to work from home and maintaining flexibility in our day-to-day workflow is important to our practice.North metro Atlanta is a highly sought-after, vibrant and diverse area known for its family-friendly neighborhoods, exceptional schools, and abundant green spaces. Residents enjoy a high quality of life with a variety of dining, shopping, and entertainment options, as well as easy access to outdoor activities such as hiking and biking. Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport, Lake Lanier and the North Georgia mountains are less than an hour away.POSITION SUMMARYNorthside Radiology Associates has an immediate opening for a Breast Radiologist to join our collegial practice in Atlanta, GA covering hospitals and imaging centers in the metro area and surrounding communities. This is an on-site position with the option to pursue the partnership-track or a full-time employed position with no call or weekends. We have state of the art equipment including 3D Digital Mammography as well as 1.5T and 3.0T MRI scanners.Diagnostic and screening mammography directed breast US, MRI and bone density.High volume of breast procedures requiring proficiency in pre-op localizations, US-guided, Stereotactic-guided and MRI-guided biopsies.Multi-disciplinary breast conferences with Surgery, Med-Onc, Rad-Onc, Nurse Navigation and GeneticsWe offer an excellent work-life balance, very competitive compensation, as well as generous benefits including CME allowance, professional licensure, profit sharing/401(k), safe harbor, moving expenses (up to IRS allowable), professional liability, health, and dental insurance, as well as life and disability insurance.DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEMD or DO, Board-Certified and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic RadiologyBoard certified by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology or Board certified in Diagnostic RadiologyFellowship trained in Breast ImagingResidents and Fellows are welcome to applyLicensure or the ability to obtain a license in GACOMPENSATION:The salary range for this position is $425,000-$800,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLYFor inquiries about this position, please contact Christie Ferguson atrecruiting@radpartners.comor 865-643-9000.RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEWRadiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is the one of the largest radiology practices in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. title: Burger King Shift Leader
description:
We need a Shift Leader to join our restaurant team. Shift Leaders are trained to perform all the duties performed by the Team Members, with additional responsibility for directing the daily operations of a restaurant in the Restaurant General Manager's and Assistant Manager's absence. This includes but is not limited to ensuring compliance with company standards in all areas of operation including product preparation and delivery, customer relations, restaurant maintenance, team management and other duties as required or assigned. 

Job Duties: 

 	* Ensure your team provides outstanding service & satisfied guests
 	* Train & coach the team
 	* Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a great restaurant every shift, every day
 	* Set an example by maintaining an excellent working knowledge and high level of proficiency in restaurant operations
 	* Provide coaching and feedback to the team
 	* Supervise in accordance with GPS values, traits and behaviors
 	* Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills
 	* Follow and enforce all cash policies; address and document any policy violations
 	* Any / all other duties as assigned by the Restaurant General Manager (RGM)

Job Requirements: 

 	* 0-2 year of supervisory experience in a restaurant or retail setting
 	* Excellent customer service skills
 	* Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
 	* Must be 18 years old and authorized to work in the US

Physical Requirements: 

 	* Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching
 	* Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures
 	* Ability to stand for 8-10 hours
 	* Ability to lift up to 20lbs

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with 

 	* Regular performance reviews
 	* Health & Life Benefits
 	* HSA program
 	* Anniversary Vacation Bonus
 	* Employee Rewards & Recognition Program
 	* Career development through structured training programs

title: Applications Engineer, Emulation and Verification
description: At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

metadata.job_description_and_requirements: We Are:At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.You Are:A Hardware-Assisted Verification Expert with deep knowledge of IP interfaces such as PCIe and DDR, and experience with Zebu, HAPS, and EP platforms. You have a proven track record in IP verification and methodology ownership focused on emulation and verification. You thrive in a matrixed, international, and team-oriented environment with multiple stakeholders. Your hands-on approach, collaborative mindset, and proactive attitude drive results. You are passionate about working closely with customer, RND, PV and Product Engineering to work on latest emulation technologies to deploy and enhance optimal solutions covering the entire ecosystem of Large SOCs, Controller and PHY, with a focus on emulation and acceleration.What You’ll Be Doing:Bridging and closing gaps between the available or required Emulation hyper scaler Designs, IP and product validations of all its functions.Reporting metrics and driving improvements in Emulation PE and RNDUsing your expertise to drive requirements for the Emulation and ensure its correct usage and deployment in verification strategies for customers.Staying ahead of evolving standards, understanding future changes, specification errata, and driving this understanding into both the Emulation IP and Design IP teams.The Impact You Will Have:Enhancing cross-functional collaboration to improve product quality and end customer satisfaction.Changing the mindset in the way we use Emulation IP in validating digital designs and architectures.Driving innovation in defining requirements for product development, in the context of Emulation.Evolving and integrating best-in-class methodologies within the organization.Standardizing and optimizing workflows to increase efficiency and compliance.What You’ll Need:8+ years of relevant experience.Results-driven mindset.Exposure to large design emulation compiles along with advanced protocols like PCIe and DDR interfaces.Experience with Zebu in the context of technology and SW validation.Proven track record in product deployment, specifically emulation.Experience in cross-functional collaborations.Excellent communication skills and a beacon for change.Adaptability and comfort in a matrixed, international environment.Who You Are:You possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills. You are a team player with excellent communication abilities. You are adaptable, proactive, and thrive in dynamic environments. Your passion for innovation and continuous improvement drives you to achieve outstanding results. Your collaborative mindset and ability to work effectively across diverse teams make you a valuable asset.The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:You will be part of a dynamic and innovative team focused on driving the next generation of emulation solutions. Our team thrives on collaboration, continuous learning, and pushing the boundaries of technology. We work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions that meet the evolving needs of our customers.Rewards and Benefits:We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

title: Burger King Restaurant General Manager
description:
We are looking for Restaurant General Managers (RGM) to join our team. Our restaurants are staffed with amazing people, and we are looking for more. The RGM leads the operation of the restaurants and has the overall responsibility for making sure the restaurant meets GPS Hospitality standards of quality, service and cleanliness. The RGM does not do this alone, as they work with a team of managers. RGM's bonus on performance, both operationally and financially.

Here are the top five (5) responsibilities of the job:

	* (P&L) Hit Your Sales and Profit Budget Every Period
	* (Systems) Execute Accurate Projections and Schedules While Working All Shifts
	* (Safety) Maintain a Safe and Clean Restaurant
	* (People) Hire and Train Service Obsessed Crew and Shift Leaders
	* (Accounting) Tight Restaurant Controls 

Job Duties:

	* Ensure team provides outstanding service and satisfied guests
	* Hire, train and coach the restaurant team
	* Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a high-quality restaurant, especially accurate projections and great schedules
	* Implement restaurant controls, especially cash & inventory
	* Frequent contact, both inside and outside the restaurant, with the public, business, and various community organizations to develop and improve the restaurant’s public relations
	* Meet standards for speed of service, food safety and cleanliness
	* Demonstrate strong critical thinking skills
	* Maintain a clean and safe working environment and ensure all equipment is clean and maintained
	* Work all shifts (breakfast, lunch, dinner late night & weekends) each week. Work at least one (1) full weekend each period
	* Follow all government regulations, employment law, food safety, operations policies and cash policies and implement all accounting controls
	* Supervise in accordance with GPS values, traits and behaviors
	* Communicate effectively with all levels of management about plans, progress and problems
	* Successfully implement all marketing promotions
	* Participate in the implementation of company policies, standards, training and management development
	* Train and develop the capabilities of Assistant Managers and Manager Trainees in the areas of management skills and technical knowledge to provide for growth

Job Requirements:

	* 3-5 years of General Manager experience in a restaurant or retail setting
	* High School Diploma or GED preferred
	* Excellent customer service skills
	* Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
	* Must have reliable vehicle and valid driver's license
	* Must be at least 18 years of age & authorized to work in the US
	* ServSafe certification preferred

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with…

	* Strong, performance-based bonus program
	* Regular performance reviews
	* Health & Life Benefits
	* HSA program
	* Generous Paid Time Off benefits
	* Employee Rewards & Recognition Program
	* Career development through structured training programs

metadata.position_description_&_requirements: Radiology Partners Borderlands is seeking a Full Time or Independent Contractor Interventional Radiologists to support our practice in Las Cruces, New Mexico. The ideal candidate is willing to work in one week blocks (Monday to Friday) and willing to take overnight call Monday – Thursday while on shift. Must be fellowship trained in Interventional Radiology and willing to read Diagnostic between procedures as needed.Position SummaryFull or Part Time Opportunities AvailableCoverage for inpatient and outpatient casesBe proficient with all aspects of interventional radiology and perform a wide range of high-end IR procedures including: angiography, embolization, ablations, UFE'S, TIPS, etc.70% IR/ 30% DxMonday – Friday 8a-5p (weeklong shifts – no partial shifts)Required Call: Monday – Thursday overnight when workingCoverage for one site onlyCompetitive shift based pay,  plus travel stipendCollegial team environmentPartnership Opportunities for full timeLOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEWRadiology Partners Borderlandsis a leader in the New Mexico Imaging market, and provides exceptional, high quality, compassionate care throughout NM. RP Borderlands supports 12 hospitals and numerous outpatient imaging centers. This IR position is to coverMemorial Medical Center – a 199 bed,Level IV trauma center located in Las Cruces, New Mexico.Las Cruces is a vibrant, steadily growing city in southern New Mexico known for its sunny climate, scenic desert landscapes, and welcoming community. Nestled at the base of the Organ Mountains, the area offers year-round outdoor recreation, including hiking, biking, golf, and easy access to White Sands National Park. Home to New Mexico State University, the city has a lively blend of cultural events, Division I athletics, local arts, and continuing education opportunities. Residents enjoy a low cost of living, affordable housing, and a relaxed lifestyle without sacrificing amenities—farm-to-table restaurants, wineries, and a historic downtown with weekly markets and festivals. With a family-friendly atmosphere, strong schools, and a growing healthcare sector, Las Cruces provides an ideal balance of work, recreation, and community connection.DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEFellowship trained in Interventional RadiologyBoard eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the      American Osteopathic Board of RadiologyDoctor      of Medicine (MD) or Osteopathy (DO), residency trained in Diagnostic      RadiologyMedical license or eligibility to obtain licensure      in the state of New MexicoCOMPENSATION:The salary range for this position is $500,000-600,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).For More information or to apply:For inquiries about this position, please contactJessica Williamsatrecruiting@radpartners.comor 405-286-3497.RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEWRadiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer.RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.Radiology Partners participates inE-verify.Beware of Fraudulent Messages:Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team atrecruiting@radpartners.com.

title: Speech Language Pathologist, SLP
description: Pediatric Therapeutic Services (PTS) is seeking a Speech-Language Pathologist (SLP) to provide school-based services for a local school district.This is a full time speech therapist opening at an elementary building from 1/5/26 until 3/5/26. The teacher hours are 8:20am- 3:50pm and the caseload right now is about 58 which is speech only and learning support students.Perks:We offer competitive rates with reimbursement for documentation, meeting attendance, and report writing.This is a 1099 Independent contracting position, allowing for greater flexibility.PTS provides consistent on-site and off-site mentorship with Clinical Directors and Team Leaders.School-Based Academy: We provide the support and community a new School-Based therapist needs to feel comfortable and be successful.Lending Library: PTS recognizes the additional expense in providing evaluation materials. We have an extensive library of testing tools and assessments for therapists to borrow as needed.Responsibilities:Implement specialized therapy treatment, techniques, and instruction in accordance with Individualized Education Programs (IEPs) of students being served.Participate in Individualized Education Program (IEP) and multi-disciplinary team meetings to assist in evaluating student needs/progress and to develop and/or revise individualized therapy interventions, objectives, and goals.Collaborate with teaching staff to plan and implement classroom-based activities and instructional techniques to ensure carry-over of learning.Provide consultative services to parents in the therapy program of their child.Compile, maintain, and file all required student documentation and reports incompliance with deadlines, confidentiality laws, federal and state laws, State Board of Education regulations, and school administrative policies and procedures.Company Profile:Each year the number of students receiving related services under Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) changes and grows. The need for expert clinicians (like you!) to serve these students is the catalyst for PTS’s mission to deliver holistic, comprehensive, education-based therapy services. For over 20 years, PTS has partnered with Independent Contractors that share this same mission. Together we can change the way we help child access their full education and have reach their potential!Qualifications:Valid state license as a Speech-Language PathologistPDE Teacher CertificationChild Abuse, Federal, and State ClearancesCF’s are welcome to apply!#MyPTSAs part of our promise to talent, Kelly supports those who work with us through a variety of benefits, perks, and work-related resources. Kelly offers eligible employees voluntary benefit plans including medical, dental, vision, telemedicine, term life, whole life, accident insurance, critical illness, a legal plan, and short-term disability. As a Kelly employee, you will have access to a retirement savings plan, service bonus and holiday pay plans (earn up to eight paid holidays per benefit year), and a transit spending account. In addition, employees are entitled to earn paid sick leave under the applicable state or local plan. Clickherefor more information on benefits and perks that may be available to you as a member of the Kelly Talent Community.Why Pediatric Therapeutic Services?Looking to impact the future of children’s lives? At PTS, we endeavor to find the right therapy or related service opportunities for providers who are dedicated to our passion of helping children thrive. PTS is leading the charge as a provider focused environment, in the areas of Early Intervention, School-Based Services, and Outpatient care. No need for you to navigate the pediatric therapy world alone. Committed to quality treatment and provider retention, we offer programming, solutions, and resources – Always allowing you to treat with confidence, knowing that mentors, other clinicians, clinical directors, resources, ideas, and experience surround you and are available for you to utilize.About KellyWork changes everything. And at Kelly, we’re obsessed with where it can take you. To us, it’s about more than simply accepting your next job opportunity. It’s the fuel that powers every next step of your life. It’s the ripple effect that changes and improves everything for your family, your community, and the world. title: Popeyes Restaurant Assistant Manager
description:
We are looking for Restaurant Assistant Managers (RAM)to join our team. Our restaurants are staffed with amazing people, and we are looking for more. The RAM supports the Restaurant General Manager in their efforts to develop a team of dedicated people, delivering great and friendly guest experiences and producing top line sales. They do this by learning, managing and teaching restaurant systems effectively to achieve goals, develop people and provide excellent service.  RAM's bonus on performance, both operationally and financially.

Job Duties:
• Ensure your team provides outstanding service and satisfied guests.
• Train and coach the team.
• Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a great restaurant every shift, every day.
• Implement restaurant controls, especially cash & inventory.
• Set and meet restaurant goals for service, operations and financial results.
• Meet all operational standards, including speed of service, food safety and cleanliness.
• Meet positive food and labor variance and take appropriate action to improve results.
• Maintain a clean and safe working environment.
• Work all shifts (breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night & weekends) as required by the business.
• Set an example by maintaining an excellent working knowledge and high level of proficiency in restaurant operations.
• Provide coaching and feedback to the team.
• Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills.
• Follow all government regulations, employment laws, food safety and operations policies and implement all accounting controls.
• Any / all other duties as assigned by the Restaurant General Manager (RGM).

Physical Requirements: 
Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching 
Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures 
Ability to stand for 8-10 hours 
Ability to lift up to 20lbs

Job Requirements:
• 1-3 year of supervisory experience in a restaurant or retail setting
• Excellent customer service skills
• Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
• Must have reliable vehicle and valid driver's license
• Must be at least 18 years of age & authorized to work in the US
• ServSafe certification preferred

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with…
• Strong, performance-based bonus program
• Regular performance reviews
• Health & Life Benefits
• HSA program
• Generous Paid Time Off benefits
• Employee Rewards & Recognition Program
• Career development through structured training programs

EEO Statement
GPS Hospitality is an Equal Opportunity employer. All persons shall have the opportunity to be considered for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, lineage or citizenship status, age, disability, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and other related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic information / characteristics, veteran or military status, marital status or any other characteristic provided by applicable federal, state or local laws.

ADAA
GPS Hospitality will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation / modification to the known physical or mental limitations of a qualified applicant with a disability to assist in the hiring process, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business, in accordance with applicable federal, state and local law. If you believe you require such assistance to complete this form or to participate in the interview process, please contact Human Resources at 770-738-8779.

title: Initiativbewerbung als Technischer Produktdesigner (m/w/d)
description: Unsere innovativen Waagen sind einfach Weltklasse! In unserem Innovations- und Kompetenzzentrum Albstadt legen wir den Fokus in der Waagen-Entwicklung auf Hardware und Software sowie auf Produktion und Logistik. Die Berücksichtigung von Computervernetzung und Industrie 4.0 machen unsere Wägetechnik einzigartig.Kommen Sie an unseren Standort Albstadt und werden Teil unseres tollen Entwicklungsteams. Gemeinsam sorgen wir für eine präzisere Welt.Sie erstellen Detailkonstruktionen und technische Zeichnungen im (Sonder-) Maschinenbau Hierbei entwickeln Sie fertigungsgerechte Einzelteil- und Baugruppenzeichnungen, erarbeiten konstruktive Teillösungen und leiten Stücklisten abÄnderung an bestehenden Konstruktionen nehmen Sie nach Vorgabe vorTechnische Dokumente verwalten Sie mithilfe des jeweiligen Systems gewissenhaftSie bauen Prototypen, Sonderwaagen und Versuchsaufbauten nach Vorgaben auf, nehmen sie in Betrieb, testen und dokumentieren sie

title: Infor
description:
Our Values

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization.

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM™. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section.

Fraud Awareness

We have been made aware of unauthorized individuals posing as Infor recruiters, including some who have made fraudulent offers of employment. Please read our guidelines and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Fraud Privacy Policy

We value your privacy at Infor. You may access our privacy policy here.

title: IKEA宜家家居 沙田分店及大埔規劃及訂購中心招聘日 (2月6日)
description:
你將會愛上宜家家居 

我們是一群務實坦誠、熱愛家居布置的人，來自世界各地，背景各有不同，但卻有同一個目標：為大眾締造更美好的生活。我們以共同的價值觀實踐目標。這些價值觀是我們工作的基礎，也是共融關愛、開明坦誠文化的基石。我們提倡團隊文化，熱誠樂觀，歡迎與我們態度及價值觀相同的人才加入。 

  

招聘日詳情 

**歡迎學生/畢業生/家庭主婦/中高齡人士參加招聘日; 為確保安排順暢，本次招聘日需提前預約面試** 


現正招募多個職位【全職/兼職 – 銷售、顧客服務、餐飲】

IKEA宜家家居 沙田分店及大埔規劃及訂購中心招聘日 (2月6日)

日期：2026年2月6日 (星期五)

時間：下午2時30分至下午6時30分

面試地點：沙田新城市中央廣場第 1 座 5 樓（IKEA 寫字樓)

預約面試：https://ikeashatin.youcanbook.me

*沙田分店*
推薦給善於與顧客溝通的你
銷售助理 (全職/兼職)

推薦給對餐飲有熱誠的你
廚師 (全職) (月薪$16,500起)
餐廳/美食站助理 (兼職)

*大埔規劃及訂購中心*
推薦給善於與顧客溝通的你
銷售助理 (兼職)

全職員工福利  

年終雙糧、每月6至7天休息日、17天公眾假期、有薪假期 (如：12-18天年假、14星期產假、5天侍產假、1星期婚假)、員工醫療保險、免供款退休計劃、集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金、良好晉升機會等 


兼職員工福利 

集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金 

  

如未能出席上述招聘日，申請者亦可WhatsApp 93751657 遞交職位申請。 

 

申請者提供之資料絕對保密，申請人之資料只供DFI零售集團附屬機構或授權之代理人作招聘及甄選用途。招聘過程完畢後，申請資料將被保留二十四個月作參考之用。本公司已備有一份「私隱政策聲明」，閣下如有需要可瀏覽公司網頁或以書面形式向人力資源部索取有關資料。申請人如在遞交申請表後六星期內仍未接獲通知約見，其有關申請將被存檔，以作日後同類型職位空缺考慮之用。

title: Burger King Team Member
description:
Our Team Members are the face of our company and the first step in providing quality service and hospitality to our guests. If you're looking for a full-time position, or just a part-time job that supports your full-time ambition, you've come to the right place. Crew member opportunities are available practically anytime: breakfast, lunch, late nights, weekends - whatever suits your schedule. To be successful in this role, Team Members must be able to smile, maintain eye contact, have a cheerful and positive attitude. 

Job Duties: 
* Connect with customers to ensure they have a positive experience 
* Help customers order their favorite meals 
* Prepare customers meals 
* Partner with other Team Members and Managers to meet daily goals and have fun 
* Keep the restaurant looking fantastic 
* Serve and Help others 

Job Requirements: 
* Excellent customer service skills 
* Willingness to learn and grow 
* Must be able to perform under pressure in a fast-paced, team environment 
* Must be at least 16 years of age & authorized to work in the US 

Physical Requirements:  
Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching 
Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures  
Ability to stand for 8-10 hours  
Ability to lift up to 20lbs

* Anniversary Vacation Bonus

title: Burger King Team Member
description:
Our Team Members are the face of our company and the first step in providing quality service and hospitality to our guests. If you're looking for a full-time position, or just a part-time job that supports your full-time ambition, you've come to the right place. Crew member opportunities are available practically anytime: breakfast, lunch, late nights, weekends - whatever suits your schedule. To be successful in this role, Team Members must be able to smile, maintain eye contact, have a cheerful and positive attitude. 

Job Duties: 
* Connect with customers to ensure they have a positive experience 
* Help customers order their favorite meals 
* Prepare customers meals 
* Partner with other Team Members and Managers to meet daily goals and have fun 
* Keep the restaurant looking fantastic 
* Serve and Help others 

Job Requirements: 
* Excellent customer service skills 
* Willingness to learn and grow 
* Must be able to perform under pressure in a fast-paced, team environment 
* Must be at least 16 years of age & authorized to work in the US 

Physical Requirements:  
Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching 
Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures  
Ability to stand for 8-10 hours  
Ability to lift up to 20lbs

title: Penetration Testing
description:
Why Work Here? Because You’ll Matter.​

We’re not hiring for roles—we’re hiring for impact. At Helix, you’ll solve hard problems, build smart solutions, and work with people who challenge and champion you. You’ll see your ideas come to life—and your work make a difference.​

We believe in trust, transparency, and grit. Our culture is inclusive, flexible, and built for people who want to stretch themselves - and support others doing the same.  Whether you’re remote or in-office, you’ll find space to show up fully and contribute meaningfully. You won’t be boxed in—you’ll be backed up.​

Make Your Mark At Helix​

If Helix excites you but you're unsure if you meet every qualification, apply anyway. We value diverse perspectives and believe the best ideas come from everywhere.​

title: Mitarbeiter:in Qualitätsmanagement
description: Als zentrale Funktion haben Sie Kontakte in alle Abteilungen und agieren als kommunikativer Dreh- und Angelpunkt zu internen wie externen Partnern. Sie treiben aktiv die Abteilung Qualitätsmanagement voran, indem Sie interne Audits ebenso professionell begleiten wie externe Zulassungs-, Lieferanten- und Kundenaudits. Mit Ihrem Engagement und Know-how gewährleisten Sie maßgeblich die nachhaltige hohe Qualität unserer Produkte und Prozesse – für maximale Kundenzufriedenheit und stetige Verbesserung. Ihre Aufgaben beinhalten im Detail:Managementsysteme und Normenkonformität: Unterstützung bei der Planung, Überwachung, Weiterentwicklung und Aktualisierung des integrierten Managementsystems nach den Standards ISO 9001, ISO 14001 und ISO 50001 mit Schwerpunkt Umweltmanagement.Audits: Vorbereitung, Begleitung und Nachbereitung von internen und externen Audits.Maßnahmenkoordination: Begleitung und Beratung in der Umsetzung von Korrektur-, Verbesserungs- und Vorbeugemaßnahmen.Projektarbeit: Mitwirkung und Leitung von Arbeitspaketen bzw. Projekten (Produktivitätssteigerung, Kostenreduzierung u.a.).Reklamationen: Unterstützung im Reklamationsmanagement, einschließlich Kundenkommunikation und eigenständiger Bearbeitung von Reklamationen mit umfassender Ursachenanalyse in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Aftersales Service Team.

title: Burger King Shift Leader
description:
We need a Shift Leader to join our restaurant team. Shift Leaders are trained to perform all the duties performed by the Team Members, with additional responsibility for directing the daily operations of a restaurant in the Restaurant General Manager's and Assistant Manager's absence. This includes but is not limited to ensuring compliance with company standards in all areas of operation including product preparation and delivery, customer relations, restaurant maintenance, team management and other duties as required or assigned. 

Job Duties: 

 	* Ensure your team provides outstanding service & satisfied guests
 	* Train & coach the team
 	* Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a great restaurant every shift, every day
 	* Set an example by maintaining an excellent working knowledge and high level of proficiency in restaurant operations
 	* Provide coaching and feedback to the team
 	* Supervise in accordance with GPS values, traits and behaviors
 	* Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills
 	* Follow and enforce all cash policies; address and document any policy violations
 	* Any / all other duties as assigned by the Restaurant General Manager (RGM)

Job Requirements: 

 	* 0-2 year of supervisory experience in a restaurant or retail setting
 	* Excellent customer service skills
 	* Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
 	* Must be 18 years old and authorized to work in the US

Physical Requirements: 

 	* Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching
 	* Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures
 	* Ability to stand for 8-10 hours
 	* Ability to lift up to 20lbs

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with 

 	* Regular performance reviews
 	* Health & Life Benefits
 	* HSA program
 	* Anniversary Vacation Bonus
 	* Employee Rewards & Recognition Program
 	* Career development through structured training programs

title: Drainlayer
description:
Our busy Higgins branch in Mount Maunganui has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Drainlayer to join the team.

This is a hands-on role where you’ll be responsible for installing and maintaining drainage systems to a high standard, while ensuring compliance with safety and environmental regulations. You’ll also have the opportunity to share your knowledge and mentor apprentices on site.

What you’ll bring to the role:
  • NZ Certified or experienced Drainlayer
  • Solid civil sector experience with proven hands-on skills 
  • WTR Endorsement and Class 2 License (preferred)
  • A strong work ethic and reliability
  • A strong focus on health and safety – for yourself, your team and the public
  • Physically fit and able to work outdoors in all weather conditions  

Come join the Green Team:
  • Competitive hourly rate + guaranteed 40 hours per week
  • Opportunity to upskill and gain further licences if required
  • Supportive team that treats each other like whānau 
  • Access to educational funds for you and your children
  • Funding for school holiday programmes and tutoring 
  • Discounts: Southern Cross, ANZ, Z energy, PlaceMakers, Mico and Samsung
  • Market-leading parental leave policy
  • Fletcher Building share scheme options

Higgins is a leading roading and civil infrastructure company in New Zealand. We are on a dynamic growth path with people at the heart of what we do every day. We offer a great working environment, competitive hourly rate, subsidised medical insurance, and subsidised education and training for you and your dependents.

Higgins is committed to a drug-free workplace. The successful applicant will be required to pass pre-employment drug and alcohol testing along with a health check. 

Building better roads for safer journeys – He pai ake te hanga o ngā rori, kia haumaru ai ngā haerenga.

We are actively looking to fill this role and encourage your early application. Applications are reviewed regularly, and we reserve the right to remove the advertisement before the advertised closing date.

Research shows that females and minority groups don’t always apply for roles unless they match 100% of the requirements. So, if this role is of interest but you feel you don’t quite fit, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are enriched by many nationalities, languages, religions, customs, and lifestyles. We are proud of our diversity and see it as one of the things that make us better together.
