title: Burger King Shift Leader
description:
We need a Shift Leader to join our restaurant team. Shift Leaders are trained to perform all the duties performed by the Team Members, with additional responsibility for directing the daily operations of a restaurant in the Restaurant General Manager's and Assistant Manager's absence. This includes but is not limited to ensuring compliance with company standards in all areas of operation including product preparation and delivery, customer relations, restaurant maintenance, team management and other duties as required or assigned. 

Job Duties: 

 	* Ensure your team provides outstanding service & satisfied guests
 	* Train & coach the team
 	* Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a great restaurant every shift, every day
 	* Set an example by maintaining an excellent working knowledge and high level of proficiency in restaurant operations
 	* Provide coaching and feedback to the team
 	* Supervise in accordance with GPS values, traits and behaviors
 	* Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills
 	* Follow and enforce all cash policies; address and document any policy violations
 	* Any / all other duties as assigned by the Restaurant General Manager (RGM)

Job Requirements: 

 	* 0-2 year of supervisory experience in a restaurant or retail setting
 	* Excellent customer service skills
 	* Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
 	* Must be 18 years old and authorized to work in the US

Physical Requirements: 

 	* Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching
 	* Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures
 	* Ability to stand for 8-10 hours
 	* Ability to lift up to 20lbs

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with

title: Finance Assistant
description: Join Our Finance Team!Are you organised, analytical, and motivated to develop your career in finance? This is a fantastic opportunity to play a key role in supporting our financial operations while ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and compliance across a variety of processes. In this role, you will:Manage daily employee expenses, ensuring policy compliance and accuracy. Assist with credit control and help resolve customer disputes with both local and global finance teams. Support the Financial Reporting Manager with audit processes. Carry out due diligence for new customer onboarding. Collaborate on month-end reporting to ensure deadlines are met. Contribute to ad-hoc projects and drive improvements to finance-related business processes. Address internal and external queries with effective, timely solutions. Respond positively to changing priorities and provide assistance when required. Utilise company systems effectively to complete tasks accurately and on time.If you are adaptable, highly organised, and ready to contribute to a collaborative and forward-thinking finance environment, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Engagement Applications Engineer, Staff
description: At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

metadata.job_description_and_requirements: We Are:At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.You Are:You are a highly motivated Staff Engagement Applications Engineer with over 4+ years of hands-on experience in synthesis or place and route (P&R). You have a robust understanding of the most advanced CPU/GPU/NPU designs and are eager to work closely with R&D on driving product development and developing advanced HPC reference flow. Your technical expertise allows you to demonstrate differentiated PPA results on the most advanced IP cores to win benchmarking and deploy HPC methodologies to our worldwide key customers to accelerate business growth. You thrive in dynamic environments and possess excellent communication skills, including a strong command of English. Your background in EE/CS, coupled with your experience with EDA tools like DC, ICC2, and Fusion Compiler, makes you an ideal fit for this role.What You’ll Be Doing:Collaborating with R&D teams to drive product development and advanced HPC reference flow development for wide deployment.Demonstrating differentiated PPA results on CPU/GPU/NPU designs to showcase our technology's superiority.Providing technical support to key global customers to address PPA bottlenecks and design challenges on the most advanced HPC designs.Aggressively engaging in worldwide critical benchmarks and deployments to ensure the highest quality and performance of designs.Utilizing scripting languages such as Perl andTclfor automation and optimization tasks.Staying updated with the latest advancements in ASIC design flow, VLSI, and CAD development to continually improve processes.The Impact You Will Have:Enhancing the performance and efficiency of advanced CPU, GPU, and NPU designs.Driving innovations that contribute to the success of Synopsys' cutting-edge technologies.Providing critical support that helps key customers overcome their PPA challenges.Contributing to the development of new features that keep Synopsys at the forefront of the industry.Improving the overall quality and reliability of our products through meticulous design and optimization.Fostering strong relationships with global customers, reinforcing Synopsys' reputation as a leader in chip design and software security.What You’ll Need:BS/MS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science with 4+ years of relevant experience.Hands-on experience with synthesis and place and route (P&R) tools.Proficiency with EDA tools such as DC, ICC2, and Fusion Compiler.Knowledge of advanced placement and routing rules.Experience with scripting languages like Perl andTcl.Strong understanding of ASIC design flow, VLSI, and CAD development.Never give-up attitude and flexibility in supporting worldwide engagements.Who You Are:Excellent communicator with strong command of English.Highly motivated and self-driven.Detail-oriented with a focus on quality and performance.A team player who thrives in collaborative environments.Adaptable and eager to learn new technologies and methodologies.The Team You’ll BeAPart Of:You will join a dynamic and innovative team focused on developing and optimizing advanced HPC designs. Our team collaborates closely with R&D to drive technological advancements and provide top-tier support to our global customers. We are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what's possible in chip design and software security, and we are looking for like-minded individuals to join us on this exciting journey.Rewards and Benefits:We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Clickherefor more information on benefits and perks that may be available to you as a member of the Kelly Talent Community.Why Kelly®Education?Looking for meaningful work that enriches the lives of students? At Kelly Education, we connect passionate people with great jobs in schools all across the country. Whether you’re looking to work a few days a week or every day, want to work in a teaching or non-teaching role—we’ll connect you with flexible work you can feel good about. Even if you’re new to the education field, our thorough training and orientation will prepare you to be successful.About KellyWork changes everything. And at Kelly, we’re obsessed with where it can take you. To us, it’s about more than simply accepting your next job opportunity. It’s the fuel that powers every next step of your life. It’s the ripple effect that changes and improves everything for your family, your community, and the world. Which is why, here at Kelly, we are dedicated to providing you with limitless opportunities to enrich your life—just ask the 300,000 people we employ each year.Kelly is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants regardless of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status, and we take affirmative action to recruit, employ, and advance qualified individuals with disabilities and protected veterans in the workforce. Requests for accommodation related to our application process can be directed to the Kelly Human Resource Knowledge Center. Kelly complies with the requirements of California’s state and local Fair Chance laws. A conviction does not automatically bar individuals from employment. Kelly participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

title: R&D Laboratory Technician
description:
At Fletcher Building, we’ve been shaping New Zealand’s built environment for over 100 years. From iconic infrastructure to sustainable solutions, we’re committed to creating spaces where communities thrive. Our people are at the heart of everything we do, and we’re proud to foster an inclusive, supportive workplace where your ideas matter.

Why You’ll Love Working with Us
  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Opportunities for career development, including funded study toward concrete technology qualifications
  • Supportive team culture focused on safety and wellbeing
  • Access to Fletcher Building’s employee discounts and wellbeing programs
About the Role

As an R&D Laboratory Technician, you’ll play a key role in our materials lab, performing concrete and aggregate testing to national standards. You’ll work closely with a collaborative team, ensuring accuracy and quality in every step of the process. This is a hands-on role where your attention to detail and problem-solving skills will shine.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Conduct laboratory and occasional field tests following national standards
  • Prepare, label, and cure test samples with precision
  • Collect and analyze data, maintaining accurate records
  • Care for equipment and assist with lab maintenance
  • Support health, safety, and environmental practices every day
What We’re Looking For
  • Strong practical skills with a keen eye for detail
  • Reasonable maths and problem-solving ability
  • A valid driver’s license (manual driving required) and forklift license
  • Experience in concrete production or testing is an advantage
  • Comfortable working in a team and in varied conditions
Ready to make an impact? Apply today and help us build a better future.

Our teams thrive on diversity, embracing various nationalities, languages, religions, customs, and lifestyles. Our diversity is one of the things that make us better together. If this role interests you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement

title: Applications Engineer, Senior Engineer
description: At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

metadata.job_description_and_requirements: Top responsibilities for this position We are looking for a motivated and innovative candidate to join our team. Responsibilities to support and deploy STA sign-off solution include: · Primary responsibilities as providing technical support to the top Synopsys customers on STA and ECO domains. · Interact with product teams and R&D on improvement of the product and help with enhancement of the Product to cater customer advance tech needs · Evaluate information needs of the users and develop creative solutions to address these needs.Technical/hard skills needed Candidate must have at least 3+ years of experience, preferably in the semiconductor domain, or overall, a mix of STA analysis, ECO, timing closure at block or Soc experience (2+ years as a STA/ECO engineer). · Proficiency in Technical Support to effectively assist clients and resolve issues in Timing Signoff domain. · Experience in PrimeTime and PrimeClosure/PTECO/Tweaker. · Knowledge in Implementation is a plus. · Excellent written and verbal communication skills. · Thorough understanding of technical writing processes.Soft skills and personality traits Good to have: Familiar with python and/or TCL scripting for automation. · Functional knowledge of Linux or UNIX.Role and Team Overview:Role's contribution to Synopsys' success This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the Applications Engineering team that supports Synopsys Signoff (PrimeTime, PrimeClosure) Product platform. The primary focus in this role would be to provide technical support to the top Synopsys customers on STA and ECO domains that will aid in efficient adoption/usage of PrimeTime, PrimeClosure tool and its features by end users. This job involves cross-team collaboration and working closely with multiple organizations like R&D, Product Engineers, Application Engineers and Marketing teams. We’re looking for an Application Engineer to join our world-class AE team. You will help with providing technical and engineering insight and direction to improve usability, applicability, and adoption of Synopsys Signoff products, platforms, and solutions to meet the customer’s business needs. Does this sound like a good role for you?Core purpose and focus of the teamSignoff Group is all about delivering comprehensive, high-performance, high-value solutions for VLSI Design and manufacturing to our customers while driving growth. Industry-leading PrimeTime & PrimeClosure platform is used by many chip-design companies as a STA sign-off & ECO solution at all technology nodes. PrimeTime platform is integrated into broader Synopsys Signoff products to accelerate design closure for manufacturing, by enabling independent sign-of-quality analysis and capabilities of ECO.We Are:At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.You Are:You are a passionate, resourceful, and innovative engineering professional who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. With a strong foundation in Static Timing Analysis (STA) and Engineering Change Order (ECO) flows, you are eager to apply your knowledge to support the world’s leading semiconductor companies. Your curiosity drives you to explore new technologies and solutions, and you are always ready to tackle complex technical challenges head-on. You take pride in your ability to communicate technical concepts clearly, both in writing and verbally, and you understand the importance of building strong relationships with customers and internal teams alike.You are motivated by a desire to make a tangible impact on the design and manufacturing of cutting-edge chips, and you enjoy the satisfaction that comes from helping customers solve their most pressing technical issues. Your experience with industry-standard tools such as PrimeTime, PrimeClosure, and PTECO/Tweaker sets you apart, and you are always looking for ways to enhance your skill set—whether it’s through scripting, automation, or learning about the latest advancements in VLSI design. You are detail-oriented, proactive, and committed to continuous improvement, both for yourself and for the products you support.Above all, you are a collaborative team player who values diverse perspectives and believes in the power of innovation to drive positive change. If you are ready to contribute to a dynamic team that is shaping the future of electronic design, we want to hear from you.What You’ll Be Doing:Providing expert technical support to top Synopsys customers on STA and ECO domains, ensuring smooth adoption and optimal usage of PrimeTime and PrimeClosure solutions.Collaborating closely with product teams, R&D, and other stakeholders to relay customer feedback and contribute to the ongoing enhancement of our signoff tools.Evaluating customer requirements and developing creative, actionable solutions to address their unique technical challenges.Assisting users in troubleshooting timing signoff and closure issues, guiding them through best practices and advanced tool features.Creating and maintaining technical documentation, application notes, and knowledge base articles to empower users and streamline support processes.Developing and deploying automation scripts (Python, TCL) to improve support efficiency and enable customers to maximize productivity.Participating in cross-team initiatives and knowledge-sharing sessions to drive continuous improvement and foster a culture of innovation.The Impact You Will Have:Accelerate the successful adoption of Synopsys PrimeTime and PrimeClosure tools by global customers, enabling faster time-to-market for their products.Enhance customer satisfaction through proactive, high-quality technical support and solution delivery.Drive continuous product improvement by channeling user feedback and real-world insights to R&D and product management teams.Strengthen Synopsys’ reputation as a trusted technology partner and industry leader in signoff and ECO solutions.Empower customers to achieve higher performance, better quality, and more efficient design closure at advanced technology nodes.Contribute to the growth and success of the Applications Engineering team by sharing knowledge, mentoring colleagues, and fostering an inclusive, collaborative environment.What You’ll Need:At least 3+ years of experience in the semiconductor industry, with a focus on STA analysis, ECO flows, and timing closure at block or SoC level (minimum 2+ years as an STA/ECO engineer).Hands-on expertise with Synopsys PrimeTime and PrimeClosure/PTECO/Tweaker tools.Strong proficiency in providing technical support and guidance in the Timing Signoff domain.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a proven ability to convey complex technical information clearly.Solid understanding of technical writing processes and documentation standards.Familiarity with Linux or UNIX environments and basic scripting skills (Python and/or TCL) for automation is a plus.Knowledge of digital implementation flows and methodologies is desirable.Who You Are:An analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.A collaborative team player who thrives in a diverse, cross-functional environment.Self-motivated, proactive, and eager to take ownership of challenges and opportunities.Adaptable and open to learning new tools, technologies, and methodologies.Excellent interpersonal skills, with a customer-centric mindset and a passion for delivering results.The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:You will join the high-performing Synopsys Signoff Group, a team dedicated to delivering comprehensive, high-value solutions for VLSI design and manufacturing. As part of the Applications Engineering team, you will work alongside experts in STA, ECO, and digital design, collaborating with R&D, product engineering, and marketing teams. The group is focused on accelerating design closure and enabling independent, high-quality analysis through the industry-leading PrimeTime and PrimeClosure platforms—trusted solutions used by top chip design companies worldwide.Rewards and Benefits:We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

title: Burger King Shift Leader
description:
We need a Shift Leader to join our restaurant team. Shift Leaders are trained to perform all the duties performed by the Team Members, with additional responsibility for directing the daily operations of a restaurant in the Restaurant General Manager's and Assistant Manager's absence. This includes but is not limited to ensuring compliance with company standards in all areas of operation including product preparation and delivery, customer relations, restaurant maintenance, team management and other duties as required or assigned. 

Job Duties: 

 	* Ensure your team provides outstanding service & satisfied guests
 	* Train & coach the team
 	* Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a great restaurant every shift, every day
 	* Set an example by maintaining an excellent working knowledge and high level of proficiency in restaurant operations
 	* Provide coaching and feedback to the team
 	* Supervise in accordance with GPS values, traits and behaviors
 	* Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills
 	* Follow and enforce all cash policies; address and document any policy violations
 	* Any / all other duties as assigned by the Restaurant General Manager (RGM)

Job Requirements: 

 	* 0-2 year of supervisory experience in a restaurant or retail setting
 	* Excellent customer service skills
 	* Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
 	* Must be 18 years old and authorized to work in the US

Physical Requirements: 

 	* Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching
 	* Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures
 	* Ability to stand for 8-10 hours
 	* Ability to lift up to 20lbs

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with 

 	* Regular performance reviews
 	* Health & Life Benefits
 	* HSA program
 	* Anniversary Vacation Bonus
 	* Employee Rewards & Recognition Program
 	* Career development through structured training programs

EEO Statement 
GPS Hospitality is an Equal Opportunity employer. All persons shall have the opportunity to be considered for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, lineage or citizenship status, age, disability, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and other related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic information / characteristics, veteran or military status, marital status or any other characteristic provided by applicable federal, state or local laws.

GPS Hospitality will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation / modification to the known physical or mental limitations of a qualified applicant with a disability to assist in the hiring process, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business, in accordance with applicable federal, state and local law. If you believe you require such assistance to complete this form or to participate in the interview process, please contact Human Resources at 770-738-8779.

metadata.position_description_&_requirements: POSITION SUMMARYBoca Radiology Group (BRG) is a 50 person sub-specialized, diversified, state of the art private practice in sunny southeast Florida covering a tertiary 400 bed hospital with Level 3 ED, 11 outpatient imaging centers and teleradiology sites. The group prides itself on being at the forefront of new procedures and technology including seven 3.0 Tesla MRI machines, specialized MARS techniques, DECT, and SPECT-CT. Our MSK section is high volume and well balanced by professional and collegiate athletics, sports medicine, rheumatology, emergency, and hospital-based cases.BRG is seeking a ABR BE/BC full-time Neuroradiologist to join our team-orientated practice. The ideal candidate will have strong clinical skills in diagnostic neuroradiology including MRI, MRA, CT, CTA and CT stroke perfusion. MR perfusion, Brain morphometry, DTI, PET Brain, DaTScans, and MR Imaging in clinical trials are also routinely performed. Our hospital has a Comprehensive Stroke Certification with The Joint Commission.This is an on-site position with a typical day shift schedule. Call is 1 weekend day shift per month. Compensation and benefits are highly competitive. Partnership opportunity and relocation support are available. Be a part of the most technologically advanced imaging team in Palm Beach County! Candidates have the ability to live where other people vacation.POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESSchedule: M-FShift: 8am-5pm ESTCall Requirement: NO OVERNIGHT Responsibility100% NeuroradiologyAbility to ready MRI, MRA, CT, CTA and CT stroke perfusionDESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEBoard certified or Board Eligible by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of RadiologyCandidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic RadiologyCAQ PreferredAbility to obtain a Florida license is required •	Fellows and Residents welcome to applyBENEFITSCompetitive CompensationPartnership track opportunityAdditional Moonlighting availableRelocation Assistance AvailableFull Coverage Benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401K, Medical Malpractice InsuranceCOMPENSATION:The salary range for this position is $500,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:For inquiries about this position, please contact Katherine Brantley atrecruiting@radpartners.comor 704-569-5055.Community OverviewNestled in South Florida’s stunning Palm Beach County, Boca Raton is the epitome of upscale coastal living. Known for its pristine beaches, lush parks, and year-round sunshine, this vibrant city offers an unparalleled quality of life.Boca Raton boasts world-class dining, shopping, and cultural attractions, including the Mizner Park district and the Boca Raton Museum of Art. Its top-rated schools, safe neighborhoods, and abundant recreational activities make it a prime choice for families and professionals alike.Conveniently located near Miami and Fort Lauderdale, Boca Raton combines the charm of a beach town with the sophistication of a cosmopolitan city. Make Boca Raton your home and experience the perfect blend of elegance, community, and coastal beauty!RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEWRadiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion, and a healthy respect for differences.Radiology Partners participates inE-verify.Beware of Fraudulent Messages:Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment.  All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team atrecruiting@radpartners.com.

title: Burger King Restaurant Assistant Manager
description:
We are looking for Restaurant Assistant Managers (RAM)to join our team. Our restaurants are staffed with amazing people, and we are looking for more. The RAM supports the Restaurant General Manager in their efforts to develop a team of dedicated people, delivering great and friendly guest experiences and producing top line sales. They do this by learning, managing and teaching restaurant systems effectively to achieve goals, develop people and provide excellent service.  RAM's bonus on performance, both operationally and financially.

Job Duties:

	* Ensure your team provides outstanding service and satisfied guests
	* Train and coach the team
	* Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a great restaurant every shift, every day
	* Implement restaurant controls, especially cash & inventory
	* Set and meet restaurant goals for service, operations and financial results
	* Meet all operational standards, including speed of service, food safety and cleanliness
	* Meet positive food and labor variance and take appropriate action to improve results
	* Maintain a clean and safe working environment
	* Work all shifts as required by the business
	* Set an example by maintaining an excellent working knowledge and high level of proficiency in restaurant operations
	* Provide feedback and coaching to the team
	* Demonstrate problem solving skills
	* Follow all government regulations, employment laws, food safety and operations policies and implement all accounting controls
	* Any / all other duties as assigned by the Restaurant General Manager (RGM)

Physical Requirements:

	* Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching
	* Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures
	* Ability to stand for 8-10 hours
	* Ability to lift up to 20lbs

Job Requirements:

	* 1-3 year of supervisory experience in a restaurant or retail setting
	* Excellent customer service skills
	* Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
	* Must have reliable vehicle and valid driver's license
	* Must be at least 18 years of age & authorized to work in the US
	* ServSafe certification preferred

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with…

	* Strong, performance-based bonus program
	* Regular performance reviews
	* Health & Life Benefits
	* HSA program
	* Generous Paid Time Off benefits
	* Employee Rewards & Recognition Program
	* Career development through structured training programs

title: Inside Sales Support Coordinator
description: As our Inside Sales Support Coordinator, you will process order flow by examining incoming orders, validating data accuracy, coordinating with key stakeholders, and executing essential daily operations to ensure departmental efficiency. This role will collaborate with regional sales managers to support account growth strategies, evaluate user specifications, create quotations, audit technical orders, and support maintaining the opportunity pipeline. You will also serve as a customer liaison, building and sustaining strong business relationships and customer loyalty through effective communication and support. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Communicating information to customers and sales agencies regarding the availability of parts, list pricing, shipment dates, and tracking numbers based on inbound inquiries. Overseeing the completion of CRM tasks assigned by internal teams. Assisting with billing disputes. Proactively communicating with customers regarding overdue items. Supporting entry of complex orders. Reviewing outstating pipeline and supporting the Regional Sales Manager (RSM) by requesting opportunity follow-up/updates from channel partners. Coordinating with RSMs within the organization to achieve problem resolution and addressing customer issues promptly and effectively. Supporting the process of account qualification to determine account potential. Accurately completing professional customer quotations and pre-sales activities. Working closely with the data steward to maintain CRM database accuracy.

title: Universal Banker Associate - Jackson, MS
description:
Universal Banker Associate - Full Time

$18.00 - $20.00 per hour

 

The Universal Banker Associate provides first-line, quality customer service through face-to-face performance of primary bank transactions. This position will also utilize communication opportunities to offer additional bank services and products.


 

What does it take to become a Universal Banker Associate?

  • Customer service skills for greeting and assisting customers in person, by phone, and at the drive-thru.
  • Cash handling experience, including processing deposits, withdrawals, and checks while balancing the cash drawer daily.
  • Ability to open new deposit accounts and process ATM/night depository deposits.
  • Sales skills to identify and initiate opportunities for promoting bank products.
  • Attention to detail for processing and proofing daily transactions according to guidelines.
  • Must be able to travel or be assigned to any branch location within the local market.

 

Experience: 

  • A high school diploma or general education degree (GED) is required.
  • Two years of related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience. 
  • Experience in a personal banker/customer service representative-type role is strongly preferred.

 

Liberty’s Bank and Trust’s Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
  • Solid Work/Life Balance, including PTO and paid holidays
  • Financial wellness, including an FSA 401K and match, Educational Reimbursement, and Life Insurance
  • Family assistance, including Adoption Assistance and EAP/Health and Welfare Assistance
  • Growth opportunities, including Training and Development and Leadership Development
  • Substantial perks, including Online Marketplace* discounts on a variety of goods and services, ERG/ Ambassador Group, and Free and reduced-rate bank services 

 

Liberty Bank and Trust, America’s first billion-dollar Black-owned bank, has proudly served communities across 11 states for over 50 years. We are building a team of mission-driven individuals committed to empowering people, businesses, and communities to thrive. By providing access to financial tools and services, we help achieve goals like homeownership, business growth, and financial education. Whether it’s a community, a burgeoning business, or untapped talent, we believe in the possibility of financial freedom. To find out more about our financial solutions and our community impact, visit us at www.libertybank.net

 

If you’re looking for a company where your ideas matter, your growth is supported, and your impact is acknowledged, Liberty Bank is the place for you.

title: Automotive Functional Safety & Cybersecurity Manager
description: At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

metadata.job_description_and_requirements: Alternate Job Titles:Automotive Functional Safety & Cybersecurity ManagerWe Are:At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.You Are:You are an experienced engineering professional with a passion for automotive safety and cybersecurity. Your expertise is rooted in a deep understanding of semiconductor development flows, functional safety management, and hardware lifecycle processes. You thrive in dynamic, cross-functional environments, collaborating with both internal teams and external customers to deliver world-class IP solutions that meet the highest standards of safety and reliability. You are driven by the challenge of ensuring compliance with globally recognized standards such as ISO 26262 and ISO21434, and you bring a meticulous approach to managing complex work products and project deliverables.Possessing strong leadership and project management skills, you excel at coordinating diverse teams, tracking progress, and driving quality outcomes. Your hands-on experience with technical safety concepts, FMEA/FMDA analyses, and safety cases enables you to provide critical insights and guidance throughout the product lifecycle, from concept to qualification. You are comfortable navigating the nuances of automotive reliability standards and quality frameworks, and you bring a continuous improvement mindset to every initiative.With excellent communication skills in English, you are adept at distilling complex technical requirements into actionable plans and clear documentation. You are proactive, resourceful, and adaptable, ready to support Synopsys’ mission to deliver innovative, differentiated automotive IP solutions. If you are energized by the opportunity to shape the future of automotive technology in a collaborative, global setting, we welcome you to join our team in Bangalore.What You’ll Be Doing:Managing all work products outlined in the project Safety Plan and Cybersecurity Plan, ensuring timely and thorough delivery.Overseeing the creation, review, and approval of work products derived from safety and cybersecurity requirements across all product lifecycle phases (Concept, Architectural, and Hardware levels).Coordinating with internal development teams and global automotive customers to ensure full compliance with functional safety, cybersecurity, and reliability standards.Collaborating closely with product teams to evaluate and address customer requirements related to quality, safety, cybersecurity, and reliability.Leading project and task planning, progress tracking, and reporting in coordination with cross-functional teams.Participating in and facilitating quality, functional safety, and cybersecurity reviews; preparing comprehensive reports and recommendations.Maintaining and continuously enhancing functional safety and cybersecurity methodologies, templates, and best practices.The Impact You Will Have:Elevate the safety and security standards of Synopsys Automotive IP, enabling safer autonomous and connected vehicles worldwide.Reduce product development risks for customers by ensuring robust compliance with ISO 26262, ISO21434, and other critical standards.Accelerate time-to-market for differentiated automotive products by streamlining safety and cybersecurity processes.Build customer trust and satisfaction through transparent, proactive engagement and rigorous quality management.Support Synopsys’ leadership in automotive innovation by developing and enhancing industry-leading safety and security practices.Drive continuous improvement initiatives that shape the future of automotive IP safety, reliability, and compliance.What You’ll Need:BSEE in Electrical Engineering with 10+ years of relevant experience or MSEE with 8+ years of relevant experience.Formal training in ISO 26262 and working knowledge of ISO21434.Expertise in one or more automotive protocols (DDR, PCIE, UCIE).Proven experience as a Functional Safety Manager in safety-critical applications, especially at the IP and hardware levels.Hands-on experience with ISO 26262 work products, including Technical Safety Concept, Safety Plan, FMEA/FMDA Analysis, Dependent Fault Analysis, Safety Manual, and Safety Case.Experience qualifying systems with embedded hardware to various ISO 26262 ASIL levels, up to ASIL D.Proficiency in English and in using tools such as JAMA, DOORS, or similar requirements management platforms.Knowledge of automotive reliability standards (e.g., AEC Q100) and quality standards (e.g., ISO 9001, IATF 16949) is an advantage.PMP certification is highly desirable.Who You Are:Collaborative leader and effective communicator, able to influence and align cross-functional teams.Highly organized, detail-oriented, and methodical in managing multiple projects and competing priorities.Analytical thinker with a proactive approach to problem-solving and risk management.Adaptable and comfortable working in a fast-paced, global environment.Committed to continuous learning, quality, and process improvement.The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:You’ll join our Silicon IP group, a world-class team of engineers and project managers focused on integrating advanced capabilities into automotive System-on-Chips (SoCs). Our team is dedicated to delivering safe, reliable, and secure IP solutions that empower our customers to innovate rapidly and confidently in the automotive market. You’ll collaborate with experts across domains, leveraging best-in-class methodologies and tools to set new benchmarks for functional safety and cybersecurity.Rewards and Benefits:We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

metadata.position_description_&_requirements: POSITION OVERVIEWCentral Indiana Region (CIR), a Radiology Partners practice, is seeking aFellowship Trained Breast Radiologistto join our growing breast center,Clara Fairbanks for Women, in Terre Haute, IN.We perform all modalities including MRI, CT, 3D Mammography, digital mammography, breast ultrasound, MRI-guided biopsies, Stereotactic biopsy, ultrasound core biopsy, needle localizations, Ductogram, general ultrasound, bone density and general x-ray. There is a strong emphasis on women’s imaging inclusive of interventional breast procedures. The ideal candidate will provide direction in woman’s imaging, engage with, and support the needs of referring physicians and maintain and support quality outcomes.Enjoy a highly competitive salary with flexible earning capability,commencement bonus, relocation assistance, comprehensive benefit package, and malpractice insurance coverage.PRACTICE OVERVIEWCIR is a subspecialty practice that provides services for Terre Haute Indiana, aTort Reform State,and the surrounding counties.  The practice serves Union Health - a 380 bed, acute care hospital and level III trauma facility. RP IN-CIR is a boutique sub-specialized, diversified, state of the art private practice.COMMUNITY OVERVIEWCome and see what the “Queen City of the Wabash” has to offer!  Nestled in West Central Indiana, just east of the Illinois border along the Wabash River, Terre Haute is home to Indiana State University and Rose Holman Institute of Technology.  The growing region offers historical and cultural charm and is located just 60 minutes from the Indianapolis area.POSITION HIGHLIGHTS100% Breast PositionSchedule: Monday-Friday 8am-5pm EST -Hybrid Option AvailableNO weekends, NO Holidays, No Call RequiredPartnership Track – One YearGenerous PTO – 10 weeksCollaborative Team EnvironmentIdeal Work/Life BalanceCommencement & relocation bonusesProductivity IncentivesInternal Moonlighting OpportunitiesCompetitive SalaryDESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCECandidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy, Board-certified and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic RadiologyBoard certified/eligible by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology or Board certified in Diagnostic RadiologyFellowship in Breast Imaging RequiredMQSA Certification RequiredAbility to secure an Indiana LicenseCandidates must be proficient in all aspects of Breast Imaging including breast proceduresIdeal Candidate must be compassionate, team oriented and have strong communication skillsNEW Grads Welcome!VISA candidates Welcome!COMPENSATION:The salary range for this position is $500,000-$750,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).For More information or to apply:For inquiries about this position, please contactPhysician Recruiter, Allison Mandal atrecruiting@radpartners.comor call 813-658-5872.RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEWRadiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer.RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.Radiology Partners participates inE-verify.Notice: When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History.Beware of Fraudulent Messages:Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team atrecruiting@radpartners.com.

title: SOC Engineering, Staff Engineer (Physical Design)
description: At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

metadata.job_description_and_requirements: We Are:At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.You Are:You are a passionate and driven Physical Design Engineer with a strong foundation in RTL2GDSII flows and a proven ability to independently own and deliver complex designs. With at least 5 years of hands-on experience in advanced technology nodes such as 7nm, 5nm, or even 3nm, you thrive in fast-paced, innovative environments and are eager to tackle new technical challenges. Your expertise spans the entire physical design spectrum—from synthesis, place & route, and clock tree synthesis (CTS) to timing optimization, static timing analysis (STA), timing closure, EMIR, and physical verification. You have experience in both block-level and full-chip floor-planning, and you’re adept at navigating timing constraints and closing timing on aggressive schedules. Your toolset includes industry-leading Synopsys solutions like Design Compiler, IC Compiler II, and PrimeTime, allowing you to deliver optimal results for high-frequency, low-power designs.Beyond your technical skills, you are a collaborative team player who communicates effectively across global teams, valuing diversity of thought and experience. You are motivated by problem-solving, have a keen analytical mindset, and are always seeking opportunities to automate and optimize workflows using Python, PERL, TCL, or other scripting languages. You take ownership of your work and pride yourself on delivering high-quality, robust solutions that drive organizational success. If you are excited about contributing to leading-edge silicon design and want to make a tangible impact, Synopsys is the place for you.What You’ll Be Doing:Independently own and drive full RTL2GDSII physical design implementation for advanced process nodes (7nm/5nm/3nm), ensuring successful tape-outs.Execute synthesis, place & route, clock tree synthesis (CTS), timing optimization, and static timing analysis (STA) to meet stringent performance and power targets.Perform block-level and full-chip floor-planning, physical verification, EMIR analysis, and timing closure activities.Collaborate with cross-functional teams across geographies to resolve complex design challenges and ensure design quality and schedule adherence.Utilize and optimize Synopsys EDA tools, including Design Compiler, IC Compiler II, and PrimeTime, to deliver state-of-the-art silicon solutions.Develop and maintain automation scripts in Python, PERL, TCL, or other relevant languages to streamline design flows and improve efficiency.Contribute to the continuous improvement of design methodologies and best practices, sharing insights and mentoring junior engineers as needed.The Impact You Will Have:Accelerate the delivery of high-performance, low-power silicon solutions that power next-generation technology platforms worldwide.Enable Synopsys customers to achieve first-pass silicon success through robust and innovative physical design implementations.Drive technical excellence and best practices within the team, influencing the future direction of physical design methodologies at Synopsys.Foster a collaborative and inclusive culture by working seamlessly with global teams and sharing technical expertise.Contribute to Synopsys’ leadership in EDA tools adoption, providing valuable feedback to enhance product offerings and customer satisfaction.Support strategic customer engagements and help expand Synopsys' presence in the semiconductor ecosystem through successful project outcomes.What You’ll Need:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (BE/BTech/MTech or equivalent) in Electronics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.5+ years of relevant experience in physical design, particularly in advanced technology nodes (7nm/5nm/3nm).Comprehensive hands-on experience with RTL2GDSII flows, including synthesis, place & route, CTS, timing optimization, STA, EMIR, and physical verification.Proficiency with Synopsys EDA tools such as Design Compiler, IC Compiler II, and PrimeTime.Strong scripting and automation skills using Python, PERL, TCL, or similar languages.Solid understanding of timing constraints, timing closure, and floor-planning techniques for both block-level and full-chip designs.Exposure to high-frequency design and low-power design methodologies.Who You Are:Proactive, self-motivated, and driven to achieve technical excellence.Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail.Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, comfortable working in diverse and global teams.Collaborative team player who values knowledge sharing and mentoring others.Adaptable and open to learning new technologies and methodologies in a rapidly evolving field.The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:You’ll join a world-class team of physical design engineers at Synopsys, dedicated to delivering innovative system design solutions for our global customers. Our team thrives on collaboration, technical excellence, and a shared passion for pushing the boundaries of semiconductor design. Working closely with experts across multiple domains, you will play a key role in empowering customers to achieve their silicon goals while contributing to Synopsys’ leadership in the industry.Rewards and Benefits:We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

title: Machine Operator
description: Machine Operator opportunity in Beverly, MA. 2nd & 3rd shift available. All positions are $19 per hour to start, temp to hire, OT potential.Responsibilities• Produce/package/label all products to meet or exceed all quality specifications per shop order, QCIC’s and all other required documents provided.• Operates various manufacturing and measurement equipment in a safe and orderly manner and notifies Lead/Supervisor when operating problems occur or standards cannot be met.• Meet or exceed all due dates assigned to the manufacturing shop order.• Responsible for all products manufactured.• Understanding of documentation system including reading comprehension, writing and how to complete documents accurately.• May assist engineering or manufacturing technicians with validation of processes, product, and tooling.• Understand and follow gowning processes and procedures while maintaining a clean and presentable workstation.• Physical Requirements:• Involves sitting, standing and/or walking, with frequent ability to exert up to 15 pounds of force to move objects and occasionally exert up to 30 pounds of force to move objects.The site offers liquid silicone rubber (LSR) injection molding, including insert and over-molding capabilities. It supports silicone extrusion for pharmaceutical and medical tubing with both cold deck and hot deck molding options. Beverly integrates automated molding solutions using robotics and end-of-arm tooling (EOAT) for enhanced precision and efficiency. The site performs value-added secondary operations such as slitting, assembly, and packaging to deliver ready-to-use components.Equipped with 14 molding machines ranging from 100 to 250 tons and two 2.5" extruders, Beverly operates within ISO Class 8 cleanrooms and is ISO 13485 certified and FDA registered. This combination of advanced molding, extrusion, automation, and quality systems ensures the site meets demanding medical device manufacturing requirements.As part of our promise to talent, Kelly supports those who work with us through a variety of benefits, perks, and work-related resources. title: Burger King Team Member
description:
Our Team Members are the face of our company and the first step in providing quality service and hospitality to our guests. If you're looking for a full-time position, or just a part-time job that supports your full-time ambition, you've come to the right place. Crew member opportunities are available practically anytime: breakfast, lunch, late nights, weekends - whatever suits your schedule. To be successful in this role, Team Members must be able to smile, maintain eye contact, have a cheerful and positive attitude.

* Connect with customers to ensure they have a positive experience 
* Help customers order their favorite meals 
* Prepare customers meals 
* Partner with other Team Members and Managers to meet daily goals and have fun 
* Keep the restaurant looking fantastic 
* Serve and Help others 

Job Requirements: 
* Excellent customer service skills 
* Willingness to learn and grow 
* Must be able to perform under pressure in a fast-paced, team environment 
* Must be at least 16 years of age & authorized to work in the US 

Physical Requirements:  
Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching 
Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures  
Ability to stand for 8-10 hours  
Ability to lift up to 20lbs

description: At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. metadata.job_description_and_requirements: Position: Analog Layout Design EngineerLocation: Da Nang, Viet NamWe Are:At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.Job Overview:Analog & Mixed Signal (A&MS) Team is responsible for the most advanced multi-dies interface technology: UCIe, AIB, OHBI. Our team is seeking for an Analog Layout Design Engineer to become a part of Synopsys.What You'll Be DoingWork on custom layout Analog IPs like High Speed IOs, PLL, DLL, Bandgap, High Speed macros for PHY, Clock trees…Floor planning, power design, signal routing strategy, EMIR awareness, parasitic optimization for layout blocks from schematicsDo layout verification for DRC/LVS/ERC/ANT/ESD/DFMComplete all design quality checks and data quality checksReport design and status to mentors and design leads.Create documents that required by the given tasksIf you are fresh graduated, you will be trained to perform above scope of worksWhat You'll Need:Bachelor's or Master's degree or above, major in Electrical, Electronic and Telecommunication Engineering, Computer Science, Automation and Control, Mechatronic Engineering or any other relevant.1-2 year working experience in the similar position (Fresh graduates are also welcomed and offered the on-the-job training to adapt the position's requirements.)Interested in IC design and desire to persuade long term career path with IC design.Good at English communication skillsGood team player; Highly responsible and Self-motivated.

title: Substitute Teacher- Spartanburg School District 1
description: Have you thought about becoming a Substitute Teacher? Come teach for Spartanburg School District One!Remember that teacher who made a difference in your life? Now it’s your turn! Substitute teaching is a great opportunity to be a mentor and help students become the best versions of themselves. Substitute teachers are essential to ensuring students continue to learn and grow every day.Why substitute teach?· Positively impact the education of students in your own community.· Feel good about the work you do.· Earn steady income through a variety of short- and long-term substitute positions available.· Enjoy work-life balance.Responsibilities:· Assume duties of the classroom teacher in accordance with school district lesson plans, school rules, and Kelly policies. This includes:o Leading instruction in the classroom by conducting the teacher’s existing lesson planso Instructing students on a variety of classroom topics/courseso Building positive relationshipso Assigning reasonable tasks and homework· Motivate students to learn, and encourage classroom participation· Create a classroom environment that’s conducive to learning and appropriate to the maturity and interests of students· Adapt to the various learning styles of students· For long-term assignments, it may be required to develop lessons plans, as well as create, administer, and grade tests and assignmentsMinimum requirements:– High School Diploma– 18 years or olderPerks you’ll enjoy as a substitute teacher:· Free online classroom management training to help you become a capable, confident classroom leader· Free ongoing professional development to keep your skills sharp· Paid orientation on district policies and procedures so you understand the culture and requirements of the school district· Weekly pay· Kelly-sponsored Affordable Care Act healthcare coverage, for eligible employees· Group insurance options· Ability to create a work schedule that works for you· Ability to select your preferred school locationsNext steps:· Apply now!· Share this job. title: Burger King Restaurant Assistant Manager
description:
We are looking for Restaurant Assistant Managers (RAM)to join our team. Our restaurants are staffed with amazing people, and we are looking for more. The RAM supports the Restaurant General Manager in their efforts to develop a team of dedicated people, delivering great and friendly guest experiences and producing top line sales. They do this by learning, managing and teaching restaurant systems effectively to achieve goals, develop people and provide excellent service.  RAM's bonus on performance, both operationally and financially.

Job Duties:

	* Ensure your team provides outstanding service and satisfied guests
	* Train and coach the team
	* Utilize GPS Hospitality Systems to run a great restaurant every shift, every day
	* Implement restaurant controls, especially cash & inventory
	* Set and meet restaurant goals for service, operations and financial results
	* Meet all operational standards, including speed of service, food safety and cleanliness
	* Meet positive food and labor variance and take appropriate action to improve results
	* Maintain a clean and safe working environment
	* Work all shifts as required by the business
	* Set an example by maintaining an excellent working knowledge and high level of proficiency in restaurant operations
	* Provide feedback and coaching to the team
	* Demonstrate problem solving skills
	* Follow all government regulations, employment laws, food safety and operations policies and implement all accounting controls
	* Any / all other duties as assigned by the Restaurant General Manager (RGM)

Physical Requirements:

	* Ability to perform the following motions: bending, squatting, twisting, pulling and reaching
	* Ability to work in warm and cold temperatures
	* Ability to stand for 8-10 hours
	* Ability to lift up to 20lbs

Job Requirements:

	* 1-3 year of supervisory experience in a restaurant or retail setting
	* Excellent customer service skills
	* Must be able to perform under pressure in a high-volume setting
	* Must have reliable vehicle and valid driver's license
	* Must be at least 18 years of age & authorized to work in the US
	* ServSafe certification preferred

About our benefits: We offer a passionate, fun and positive work environment, with a welcoming and supportive team, along with…

	* Strong, performance-based bonus program
	* Regular performance reviews
	* Health & Life Benefits
	* HSA program
	* Generous Paid Time Off benefits
	* Employee Rewards & Recognition Program
	* Career development through structured training programs

EEO Statement
GPS Hospitality is an Equal Opportunity employer. All persons shall have the opportunity to be considered for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, lineage or citizenship status, age, disability, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and other related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic information / characteristics, veteran or military status, marital status or any other characteristic provided by applicable federal, state or local laws.

title: Mid-Level Software Developer (SECRET CLEARANCE)
description: Mid-Level Software Developer (Contract to Hire)**Up to $120K/year***100% onsite supporting DoD customer**Requires active SECRET clearance to be considered*Job Description:Our customer is seeking a skilled and visionarymid-level software developer to lead their software development team and simultaneously to design robust solutions within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, and to help modernize a legacy application to the newest technology and approach available in the Azure Cloud. As a mid-level software developer, you will play a critical role in shaping their cloud infrastructure, ensuring scalability, security, and performance. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams, guide technical decisions, and drive innovation. If you’re passionate about cloud application development architecture and have a deep understanding of Azure services, we encourage you to apply.Company Overview:Our customer has expertise in operating, maintaining, and modernizing applications and IT systems for the Federal Government. They provide scientific and engineering expertise for critical agency missions. Their goal is to be at the forefront of change so that we can bring the best ideas to fruition for their clients’ missions.Mission & Vision:To be the leading provider of enduring systems engineering and software solutions, delivering measurable results, exceeding customer expectations, and fostering a workplace that promotes continuous growth and empowers employees to thrive, while enabling the missions of our customers and partners with high-quality products and services that lead to 100% satisfaction.Summary of the Position:The mid-level software developer is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable web applications across both front-end and back-end architectures. This role requires expertise in modern programming languages, frameworks and cloud technologies, as well as a strong understanding of user experience, performance optimization and secure coding practices.  This person collaborates with cross-functional teams - including product managers, designers, and DevOps - to deliver high-quality software solutions that align with business goals.  In addition to hands-on development this position contributes to architectural decisions and drives continuous improvement across the software development lifecycle.Essential Job Duties:Design, develop, test, and deploy full-stack web applications using modern frameworks and technologies (e.g., React, Angular, Node.js, .NET, Python, etc.)Architect scalable and maintainable software solutions that meet business and technical requirementsWrite clean, efficient, and well-documented code following best practices for performance, security, and accessibilityCollaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and other stakeholders to translate user needs into technical solutionsLead code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and ensure adherence to coding standards and development workflowsTroubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues across the stack, including front-end, back-end, and database layersIntegrate third-party APIs, services, and tools to enhance application functionalityManage CI/CD pipelines and contribute to DevOps practices for automated testing and deploymentMentor junior developers and contribute to team knowledge-sharing and skill developmentStay current with emerging technologies and recommend adoption of tools or frameworks that improve productivity and product quality.Non-Essential Duties:Participate in internal innovation initiatives, hackathons, or proof-of-concept projectsAssist in drafting technical documentation for external stakeholders or marketing teamsRepresent the company at industry conferences, meetups, or developer communitiesContribute to open-source projects or internal tooling that supports developer productivitySupport recruitment efforts by participating in technical interviews or reviewing coding assessmentsCollaborate with legal or compliance teams to ensure software aligns with regulatory standardsProvide input on UI/UX design improvements based on user feedback or analyticsHelp maintain internal knowledge bases, wikis, or developer onboarding materialsExplore and prototype emerging technologies for potential integration into future productsResponsibilities:Design, develop, and deploy cloud-native applications using Microsoft Azure servicesCollaborate with product managers, architects, and other engineers to define technical requirements and deliver high-quality softwareImplement best practices for application development, including security, scalability, and performance optimizationSupervise that developers write clean, maintainable, and efficient code in languages such as C#, .NET, JavaScript, or PythonDevelop and maintain APIs, microservices, and serverless componentsEnsure seamless modernization between on-premises systems to cloud-based applicationsSet up and manage Git and TFS repositories, ensuring version control best practicesDesign and implement CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and Azure DevOps, automating the build, test, and deployment processesArchitect and implement high-availability database systems using MS SQL, focusing on SQL Database DesignParticipate in code reviews and mentor junior engineersStay up to date with Azure services, industry trends, and emerging technologiesRequired Skills/Qualifications:Must have an active SECRET clearanceBA degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related fieldMust have five (5) or more years of Full-Stack application development preferable in an Azure cloud environmentMust have five (5) or more years of experience in both front-end and back-end technologies including C#, JavaScript, Node.JS, Angular, React, Express.JSUS Citizenship required (Please do not apply if no US Citizenship)Microsoft AZ-900 Azure Fundamentals or any higher Azure CertificationProficiency in Microsoft Azure services, including Azure App Service, Azure Functions, and Azure SQL DatabaseProficiency with architecture and data modeling for applications, data flows and securing data at rest and in-transitProficiency designing and implementing cloud-native applicationsExperience with containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and serverless computingKnowledge about cross-domain cloud connection/trafficFamiliarity with Azure Dev/Ops, Azure AI, Azure ML and Azure AI SearchService Now experiencePreferred Skills/Qualifications:IAT Level I Certification will be required for this position. Candidates must currently have or should be able to obtain IAT Level 1Certifications (Ex: A+CE, CCNA-Security, Network+CE, SSCP, Security+)Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect ExpertMicrosoft Certified: Azure Developer AssociateExperience with non-SQL databases such as Cosmos DBWorking ConditionsStandard office environmentMay require extended hours during project deadlines or system implementationsPhysical Requirements:Prolonged periods in stationary position at a desk and working on a computerMust be able to lift up to 15 pounds at timesThe person in this position needs to occasionally move throughout the office, including across longer distances such as from the building entrance to the workspaceDisclaimer:This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed. We are currently seeking a dedicated Machine Operator to join our team at our North Andover manufacturing facility.Job Summary:The Machine Operator will set up and operate equipment that converts large rolls of paperboard into sheets and/or coats and laminates rolls of paperboard to film, foil, or other rolls of paperboard. title: Sample Runner
description: Job Title:Sample RunnerPosition Summary:The Sample Runner is an entry-level role that supports manufacturing operations by collecting and delivering samples from both in-plant and off-site distribution terminals to the laboratory for analysis. Training is provided; no prior lab or sampling experience is required. A company vehicle is provided for all sample collection duties.Key Responsibilities:Trains to perform all routine job functions under the guidance of a senior team member until proficiency is achieved.Drives a company vehicle to collect samples following the Sample Plan, both within the plant and at off-site distribution terminals.Accurately documents sample pickup time, location, and material type.Consistently performs work duties in a safe manner and adheres to all safety protocols.Escalates any safety concerns related to vehicles, samples, driving conditions, or site access in a timely fashion.Monitors analytical systems as assigned and escalates issues according to procedure.Follows all Environmental, Health & Safety (EH&S) and Operating Discipline Management System (ODMS) procedures for assigned tasks.Suggests improvements to work processes and tools as needed.Maintains timely filing of all required documentation and forms.Completes all required safety and operational training on time.Education & Experience:No prior experience required; training provided.High school diploma or equivalent is preferred, but not required.Must hold or be able to obtain a valid Transportation Worker Identification Credential (TWIC) prior to start.Must have and maintain a clean driving record.Must be willing to work rotating shifts, which may include:12:00 AM – 10:00 AM10:00 AM – 8:00 PMShifts and schedules may vary based on business needs.Additional Information:Position requires use of a company vehicle for all sample collection; no mileage reimbursement provided.Position requires reliable driving skills and flexibility for shift work.
